body_html:
Having it always start with all runs disabled would be confusing to first-time TensorBoard users who haven't yet learned what the run selector is.

However, we could make it start with all runs toggled off if you have, say, >20 runs. That should solve this performance issue.

What do you think?
body_text:
Having it always start with all runs disabled would be confusing to first-time TensorBoard users who haven't yet learned what the run selector is.
However, we could make it start with all runs toggled off if you have, say, >20 runs. That should solve this performance issue.
What do you think?
body:
Having it always start with all runs disabled would be confusing to first-time TensorBoard users who haven't yet learned what the run selector is.

However, we could make it start with all runs toggled off if you have, say, >20 runs. That should solve this performance issue.

What do you think?
